heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 24 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: This period, starting 18 October 2025, is ranked 6th among the longest rainy periods since 23 September 2024.  It has lasted 9 days so far.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (195°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 3.3°C), outside temperature (down 3.1°C), and inside temperature (down 1.8°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.2 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 7.2°C), dew point temperature (up 5.4°C), cloud levels (up 405 m), and outside temperature (up 6.6°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 68.2m lower than yesterday, 75.5m lower than the past week, 404.8m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 732m and a high of 1468m, averaging 941.6m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: Expect overcast skies with low cloud.

Today’s average dew point temperature is 2.8°C lower than yesterday, 4.6°C lower than the past week, 5.4°C lower than the past month.

The dew point temperatures yesterday fell between 3.6°C minimum and 8.7°C maximum, with an average of 3.4°C; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 8.0°C and 8.8°C.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should remain cool. Outside; cold spells are likely. Also, the air will feel dry and little or no wind. A few light raindrops may fall, overcast skies with low cloud, and it’s dim outside. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
